summary: Public transportation in rural areas is critical to connecting people to medical services, jobs, and shopping. Coordination among transit providers serving large, sparsely populated areas can help cut costs and improve services. However, such efforts can be difficult with few resources, for example, when the transit manager is also the driver and dispatcher. The Federal Transit Administration is working to improve coordination—with mixed results. Transit...
title: Public Transportation: Enhanced Federal Information Sharing on Coordination Could Improve Rural Transit Services
